main event: The witness reported seeing a bright, shiny white object in the sky on August 25, 1961 near Wilmington, Delaware.
interesting points: The object appeared to be partly transparent and had an orange crescent-shaped reflection, possibly from the sun.
The object suddenly 'exploded', breaking into multiple pieces and leaving a small amount of what appeared to be smoke.
The witness tried to take a photograph of the object through a telescope but was unsuccessful due to insufficient light.
Other witnesses in the area also reported seeing a similar object on the same date.
The object was described as hovering or moving slowly at an extremely high altitude for over an hour before gradually fading from view.
sighted object: A bright, shiny white object, partially transparent with an orange crescent-shaped reflection
witnesses: Multiple witnesses, including the reporting party and their six-year-old daughter
